name: I Hate 1111
statement: You are given an integer $$$x$$$. Can you make $$$x$$$ by summing up some number of $$$11, 111, 1111, 11111, \ldots$$$? (You can use any number among them any number of times). For instance, $$$33=11+11+11$$$ $$$144=111+11+11+11$$$
inputFormat: The first line of input contains a single integer $$$t$$$ $$$(1 \leq t \leq 10000)$$$ — the number of testcases. The first and only line of each testcase contains a single integer $$$x$$$ $$$(1 \leq x \leq 10^9)$$$ — the number you have to make.
outputFormat: For each testcase, you should output a single string. If you can make $$$x$$$, output "YES" (without quotes). Otherwise, output "NO". You can print each letter of "YES" and "NO" in any case (upper or lower).
